title: JSON Schema for the debian/upstream/metadata file format

Archive.title: Archive
Archive.description: The name of the large archive that the upstream work is part of, like CPAN, GitHub, or GitLab.

ASCL-Id.title: ASCL Identifier
ASCL-Id.description: Identification code in the http://ascl.net (if known)

Bug-Database.title: Bug database or tracker for the project
Bug-Database.description: A URL to the list of known bugs for the project.

Bug-Submit.title: Bug submission URL for the project
Bug-Submit.description: A URL that is the place where new bug reports should be sent.

Cite-As.title: How to cite this project
Cite-As.description:
The way the authors want their software be cited in publications.

The value is a string which might contain a link in valid HTML syntax.

Contact.title: Contact point for the project
Contact.description:
Contact point for the upstream point.

Deprecated when using the machine readable format. The Upstream-Contact field in debian/copyright is the direct replacement in that case.

CPE.title: MITRE CPE values
CPE.description:
One or more space separated http://cpe.mitre.org/ values useful to look up relevant CVEs
in the https://nvd.nist.gov/home.cfm and other CVE sources.

See `CPEtagPackagesDep` for information on how this information can be used.
**Example**: `cpe:/a:ethereal_group:ethereal`

Documentation.title: Online documentation URL
Documentation.description: A URL to the online documentation for the upstream project

Donation.title: Donation URL or instructions
Donation.description: A URL for donating to the upstream project or free-text prose of instructions of how to do so

FAQ.title: URL to the projects FAQ
FAQ.description: A URL to the FAQ if upstream provides one

oneOf.title: Sources of funding
oneOf.description: Can be either an URL or one or more funding tags like `NIH U24EB029240`

oneOf.title: Sources of funding
oneOf.description: Can be either an URL or one or more funding tags like `NIH U24EB029240`

Gallery.title: URL to the projects Gallery
Gallery.description: A URL to a gallery of pictures made with the program (not screenshots).

Name.title: Name of the upstream project.
Name.description:
Contact point for the upstream point.

Deprecated when using the machine readable format. The Upstream-Name field in debian/copyright is the direct replacement in that case.

Other-References.title: Link to more references
Other-References.description: A URL to a upstream page containing more references.

Registration.title: Link to the upstream registration form
Registration.description: A URL to a registration form (or instructions). This could be registration of bug reporting accounts, registration for counting/contacting users etc.

Registry.title: Link to the upstream registration form
Registry.description:
This field shall point to external catalogs/registries of software.

The field features an array of "Name (of registry) - Entry (ID of software in that catalog)" pairs.
The names and entries shall only be names, not complete URIs, to avoid any bias on mirrors etc.

Reference.title: URL to upstream repository (clone URL)
Reference.description: One or more bibliographic references. The key names map to the BibTeX entries.

Repository.title: URL to upstream repository (clone URL)
Repository.description: URL to a repository containing the upstream sources.

Repository-Browser.title: URL to browsable view of upstream repository
Repository-Browser.description: A URL to browse the repository containing the upstream sources.

oneOf.title: URL(s) to upstream packages containing screenshots
oneOf.description:
One or more URLs to upstream pages containing screenshots (not <https://screenshots.debian.net>),
 represented by a scalar or a sequence of scalars.

oneOf.title: URL(s) to upstream packages containing screenshots
oneOf.description:
One or more URLs to upstream pages containing screenshots (not <https://screenshots.debian.net>),
 represented by a scalar or a sequence of scalars.

Security-Contact.title: How to approach upstream on security related messages
Security-Contact.description: Which person, mailing list, forum, etc. to send security-related messages in the first place.

Webservice.title: URL to service where the package program can be used
Webservice.description: URL to a web page where the packaged program can also be used.
